results.title: Life from the sea
results.creator_credit: Barry Stoner and KCTS (Television station : Seattle, Wash.)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Miracle Planet”.
The Earth’s oceans cover two thirds of the planet’s surface and have been crucial in determining the course of the Earth’s development. The creation of the seas was a turning point, the evolutionary crossroads that forever separated the Earth from the other planets in the solar system.

results.title: Something old, something new
results.creator_credit: Ben Lewin, Karl McPhee, Malcolm Smith and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “The Migrant experience”.
Long-established and recent migrants describe the search for a personal balance between the old traditions and the new ways.

results.title: Are you fair dinkum?
results.creator_credit: Ben Lewin, Malcolm Smith and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “The Migrant experience”.
Looks at national identity and how the Australian way of life has been shaped by migration and the response of migrants to it. Shows the changes that have occurred as a result of the contributions of postwar migrants to Australian culture. Considers the role played by politics, the media and education.

results.title: Working
results.creator_credit: Karl McPhee, Malcolm Smith, Australian Institute of Multicultural Affairs and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Migrant experience”.
Considers the roles migrants have played in the Australian labour force. Several historical aspects are dealt with through case studies, though the emphasis is on the nature and effect of the postwar migration boom. With work as one of the most significant points of interation between migrants and hosts, this episode examines the experience of both good and bad of the new work force.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Karl McPhee, Malcolm Smith, Australian Institute of Multicultural Affairs and Film Australia

results.title: First encounters
results.creator_credit: Ben Lewin, Karl McPhee, Malcolm Smith and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Migrant experience”.
Deals with the initial experience of various ethnic groups as they encounter Australia’s developing society and culture particularly the nature of the welcome experienced. Addresses what it is like to change cultural milieux, how forms of prejudice fit within Australian history and examines where attitudes towards migrants have changed.

results.title: Of dreams and reasons
results.creator_credit: Ben Lewin, Karl McPhee, Malcolm Smith and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Migrant experience”.
Illustrates the motivations of individuals and various ethnic groups who migrated to Australia. Looks at the convict experience, the Irish, British, northern and southern European and Pacific Islander immigrant experiences, as well as the experiences of recent refugees from Indo-China, Lebanon, Uganda, Timor and Chile. Also considers the accuracy of Australian government promotional literature and films produced to attract migrants in the postwar period.

results.title: Setting out
results.creator_credit: Ben Lewin, Malcolm Smith and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Migrant experience”.
Surveys the chief events in Australian and world history that have influenced our migration patterns and immigration laws. Notes Aboriginal migration to Australia, the First Fleet, the discovery of gold, the land boom, drought and depression in the 1890s, Federation, World War I and after, the 1930s depression, post-war immigration, multiculturalism and Asian immigration. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Communicating with a group
results.creator_credit: John Krish and Rank Audio Visual
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Manager in Action”.
This film takes the form of a dramatised in-company training session on group communication. The film is designed to improve the abilities of people to communicate effectively with all groups. The special problems of communication with groups are identified.
